Based on the preferences you've given me, I would recommend the movie "Layer Cake" to you.
The movie is about a successful cocaine dealer named Bill Chaffey who was training for his first Olympic distance triathlon when he was involved in a horrendous accident that left him a paraplegic. For four years he trained himself in the disciplines of wheelchair and hand cycle racing to complete his dream of completing a triathlon and representing Australia in a World event while remaining just one of the boys.

conversation.text:
Based on the preference cues provided, I would recommend "The Godfather" as one of the potential recommendations.
"The Godfather" is a classic film that was released in 1972.
The movie is about the Corleone family, who are powerful Mafia bosses in New York City.
The movie follows the lives of several members of the Corleone family over several decades.
Some of the notable actors who appeared in "The Godfather" include Marlon Brando (as Don Vito Corleone)), Al Pacino (as Michael Corleone)), James Caan (as Tom Hagen)), Lee Strasse (as Tom Hagen)), Richard Conte (as Michael Corleone)), Santos Rodriguez (as Michael Corleone)), and many others.
"The Godfather" is widely regarded as one of the greatest films ever made. The movie received numerous awards, including three Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Actor in a Leading Role, and Best Adapted Screenplay, respectively.
Overall, "The Godfather" is an excellent film that offers a captivating storyline, impressive acting performances, and a memorable soundtrack.
